title: Specify the Alert Rules
description: An array of rule objects, each representing a specific monitoring rule.

logql.title: The logql used to fetch logs from Loki

polling.title: The polling interval defines how often Sigyn will fetch logs from Loki
polling.description:
Can be a duration string (e.g. '1m', '1h', '1d') or a cron expression (e.g. '* * * * *', '*/2 * * * *').
Multiple polling is supported with cron expression only.
If not specified, the default value is '1m' (1 minute).

alert.title: The alert configuration
alert.description: Defines how Sigyn will trigger and send an alert.

on.title: Defines how Sigyn will trigger an alert

count.title: The number of logs to trigger an alert
count.description: Can be a number or a range string (e.g. '< 4', '>= 5'). By default, the operator is '>=', it means that if no operator specified, the alert will be triggered when the number of logs is greater or equal to the count value.

interval.title: The interval of time in which the logs will be counted

template.title: The template used to send the alert
template.description:
Can be a string or an object.
If it's a string, it must be a reference to a root template key.
If it's an object, it will be used as the template itself.

disabled.title: Disable the rule
disabled.description: If true, the rule will be disabled.

notifiers.title: The notifiers used to send the alert
notifiers.description:
An array of notifier names. Theses notifiers must be installed.
Sigyn notifiers can be unscopped (e.g. 'discord') or scopped (e.g. '@sigyn/discord').
If not specified, default to each notifiers configured.

labelFilters.title: The label filters used to filter logs
labelFilters.description:
An array of label filters. Each label filter is a Loki label filter (e.g. '{job="my-job"}').
Each filter duplicates the rule with the updated LogQL.
